name: @measure_erosion_thick
author: AFNI Developers
description: Compute thickness of mask using erosion method.

inputs.description: Surface dataset onto which to map thickness (probably a pial/gray matter surface).
inputs.name: Surfset

inputs.description: Output directory. If not specified, erosion_thickdir is used.
inputs.name: Output Directory

inputs.description: Resample input to mm in millimeters (put a number here). Recommended for most 1mm data.
inputs.name: Resample

inputs.description: Smooth surface map of thickness by mm millimeters. Default is 8 mm.
inputs.name: Surface Smooth

inputs.description: Smooth volume by mm FWHM in mask. Default is 2*voxelsize of mask or resampled mask.
inputs.name: Volume Smooth

inputs.description: Search for maximum thickness value of mm millimeters. Default is 6 mm.
inputs.name: Maximum Thickness

inputs.description: Map to surface by looking for max along mm millimeter normal vectors. Default is 3 mm.
inputs.name: Depth Search

inputs.description: Do not delete the intermediate files (for testing).
inputs.name: Keep Temporary Files

inputs.description: Heat method used for smoothing surfaces. Default is HEAT_07 but HEAT_05 is also useful for models.
inputs.name: Surface Smooth Method

output-files.description: Unsmoothed thickness mapped to surface nodes.
output-files.name: Unsmoothed Thickness Surface Nodes

output-files.description: Smoothed thickness mapped to surface nodes.
output-files.name: Smoothed Thickness Surface Nodes

output-files.description: Simple specification file for surface to use with suma commands.
output-files.name: Quick Specification File
